name: Persian Rice
author: Chef John
summary: I believe I've posted a few fool-proof methods for cooking perfect rice, but this Persian version takes the grand prize, and it's not even close for second. The beauty of this method is that it doesn't rely on any specific measurements, or even exact times. This will make some of you very nervous, but just go with it.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons butter, cut into thin slices, or to taste
1 tablespoon chopped parsley, or to taste
directions: Bring water and kosher salt to a boil in a pot; add rice and cook, stirring, for exactly 7 minutes
Heat olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat
Cover bottom of pot with 1 layer of potato slices
Sprinkle cumin and salt over potatoes
Cook until potatoes are sizzling, 2 to 3 minutes; top potatoes with rice to form an even layer
Reduce heat to low and place butter slices over rice
Top pot with a layer of clean paper towels and place lid over towels
Steam until rice is fluffy, about 45 minutes
Grind saffron threads with a mortar and pestle
Mix crushed saffron with 1 1/2 tablespoons hot water in a large bowl
Add a couple spoonfuls of rice to saffron mixture and stir until rice is yellow
Spoon remaining rice into a serving bowl, top with saffron rice, and line edges of bowl with potatoes
